Issues.Title: [Loc] The PrintPreview dialog is not translated
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20419.9
* Affected Languages: CHS, CHT

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application
2. Drag and drop button and PrintPreviewDialog to Form designer.
3. Double-click the button to generate the click event, then enter code "printPreviewDialog1.ShowDialog();" in this event.
4. Build and run this project, then click button.
5. Observe the PrintPreview dialog that pops up.

**Expected behavior:**
The PrintPreview dialog should be translated.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/90732031-10855c00-e2fd-11ea-9504-c147b6038076.png)

**Actual behavior:**
The PrintPreview dialog is not translated.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/90732100-2bf06700-e2fd-11ea-9050-8fdd2f32282a.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Loc] The PrintPreview dialog is not translated" (#3747)

Issues.Title: Narrator does not announce or focus on ListView headers.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**.NET Core Version:  5.0**
- NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20411.10

**Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:**
- Yes (.NET Framework 4.7.2)

**Problem description:**
The ListView control contains column headers. If user hovers mouse cursor on column header then Narrator should announce Text of highlighted column header.

**Actual behavior**
Narrator doesn't announce text from column header when user hovers mouse cursor on column header
![3745-Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/90632993-efa20580-e22d-11ea-9a7e-4a2178de79b4.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
Narrator should announce text from column header when user hovers mouse cursor on column header
![3745-Expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/90632997-f16bc900-e22d-11ea-9805-951fcfbe6eb4.gif)

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create list view with several columns
2. Hover cursor on any column header
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Narrator does not announce or focus on ListView headers. " (#3745)

Issues.Title: `Debug.Assert` no longer shows a dialog prompt
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: **.NET Core 3.1 onwards**

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: **No**

**Problem description:**

`System.Diagnostics.Trace.Assert` and `System.Diagnostics.Debug.Assert` no longer trigger a dialog prompts in desktop apps. Instead apps silently silently crash unless have a debugger attached.

As discussed in https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/40512, the assert behavior was changed in dotnet/coreclr#20764, and no longer raises a dialog.
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.Diagnostics.Debug/tests/DebugTestsUsingListeners.cs#L248-L303 illustrates how to implement a custom trace listener, which may act as a basis for a fix.


**Expected behavior:**

No crash, and assertion dialog must appear after assert.

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create new WinForm Core project. 
2. Put `System.Diagnostics.Debug.Assert(false, "test");` anywhere in the code, for example:
    ```cs
	protected override void OnShown(EventArgs e)
	{
		base.OnShown(e);
		System.Diagnostics.Debug.Assert(false, "test");
	}
    ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`Debug.Assert` no longer shows a dialog prompt" (#3739)

Issues.Title: fix: RTB retrieve hidden text
Issues.Body:
Resolves #3399


<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->


## Proposed changes

In .NET 4.7 instead of using the old RichEdit2.0/3.0 a new version of RichEdit4.1 was used, which no longer allows to provide hidden text via the existing mechanics of EM_STREAMOUT.
However in .NET Desktop allowed switching to the old RichEdit control via configuration quirks.

In .NET Core 3.0 we have deprecated the old control, which essentially
breaks certain scenarios.

Restore the ability to read hidden text.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Customers relying on RichTextBox's behaviour to retrieve hidden text can now migrate to .NET 5.0

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual
- Unit tests


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3726)


Co-authored-by: mavnorthwind <mavnorthwind@users.noreply.github.com>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix: RTB retrieve hidden text" (#3726)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in AssemblyRef, SRCategoryAttribute and SRDescriptionAttribute
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in AssemblyRef, SRCategoryAttribute and SRDescriptionAttribute.

Issues.Title: Update DataGridView columns' HeaderText and Name in Accessibility sample app
Issues.Body:
Fixes about changing the column headers names in the accessibility sample app because screen readers have included the column index in the name.


## Proposed changes

- Update related codes in DataControls.Designer.cs and DataControls.cs files


## Customer Impact
- After this update, NVDA still read Row and Column information in order to expose NVDA itself issue

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

-No

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- screen readers test

Issues.Title: Simplify HDC caching
Issues.Body:
We're getting intermittent errors in tests when trying to create a Graphics object from a cached DC. For 5.0 rolling this cache back to be per thread and no longer use the background thread to create HDCs. Also add additional diagnostics so we can better follow up on errors when they occur.

Issues.Title: Cannot build master after updating VS preview
Issues.Body:
**.NET Core Version:**
master

**Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:**
no, not relevant

**Problem description:**

Building master fails because it does not find `C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019/Preview/VC/Tools/MSVC/14.27.29109/bin/Hostx64/x86/cl.exe`

In particular the MSVC version `14.27.29109` is wrong, I updated the current preview and it now has a higher version.

**Expected behavior:**
Be more version tolerant than hardcoding a fixed version, people may want to go back and build older WinForms versions from the github history in the future to diagnose issues, so if you hardcode the "now current" compiler version this will be a major pain in the future when this version is no longer current.

**Minimal repro:**
Update VS to current preview and try to build master.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot build master after updating VS preview" (#3727)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#3724)

Issues.Title: A blank .NET Core 3.1 WinForms app, published as self-contained and trimmed, still bundles all WPF DLLs
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 

```
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.1.401
 Commit:    39d17847db

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19041
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.401\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.1.7
  Commit:  fcfdef8d6b
```

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
N/A

**Problem description:**
A blank 3.1 WinForms app, published as self-contained and trimmed, still bundles all WPF assemblies, which adds at least extra 12MB. 

**Expected behavior:**
WPF assemblies (`Presentation*.dll` etc) should not be included if the are not used. 

**Minimal repro:**

```
dotnet new winforms 
dotnet publish -r win-x64 -c Release --self-contained true /p:PublishTrimmed=true 
cd .\MyFormsAppCore\bin\Release\netcoreapp3.1\win-x64\publish 
dir Presentation*.dll
```

Note all `Presentation*.dll`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A blank .NET Core 3.1 WinForms app, published as self-contained and trimmed, still bundles all WPF DLLs" (#3723)

Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Update FxCopAnalyzers.
